intro: Parietaria huetia, commonly known as the rock pepper or wall pepper, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Parietaria huetia is often found growing in rocky or disturbed soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
